if you are referring to the customers environment.

On Escalation Ticket # 00434210 the new comment has been added: Can I get a status update on this?
Customer is apprehensive of using this on a large scale, if they can't trust the job results.
They are trying to use this to purge malicious files.

On Escalation Ticket # 00434210 the Following Fields have been updated:

On Escalation Ticket # 00434210 the new comment has been added: Chris Brooks:

@Salesforce
There should be an input.db file located at:

STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITFileSystemAMDatasession-yyyymmddThhmmssinput.db
Or it can be located as previously mentioned here
StealthbitsStealthAUDITActionsFileSystemyyyymmddThhmmssHOST.input1.db


Every action execution produces that input.db so if it's not there in either location someone may have deleted it.

We want to get that input.db file so we can validate whether the action is targeting the directory or the file because this looks very similar to another issue we had with a different customer (https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce.com/500Qk00000IlzH1IAJ) and the resolution would be to update the action to target the file rather than the folder. 
@WaitingOnEngineer

[DevOps CommentId:11646880]
